--- Roger Smith <rog_21@...> wrote:
> I am with you guys on this.  Thanks for the input
> Derek, Kenneth, and Colin.  The reason I originally
> came to this group was because I asked about a
> program
> I was trying to write for JRobots.

Small world. :)

> You are very right Colin, although I have not looked
> too much into NEAT as of yet, we would have to pare
> down some things to fit within the contraints of
> JRobots.  

I'm not really all that interested in actually
entering a NEAT-produced bot into the official
competition (I'm not interested in meeting their
necessary requirements either...as Colin pointed out,
it'd be a pain in the butt).  

I *am* interested in using their freely available
environment and plethora of pre-programmed AI
opponents as a testbed for a NEAT-evolved player (if
that's possible...if not, I won't mess with it).

As far as a repository for domains, I think setting
one up on the neuroevolution.com domain would be a
good idea.  Ken already uses the Users Page as a
repository of sorts for versions of NEAT.

Philip and I hope to opensource our Java version
(hopefully by the end of the year!) on Sourceforge,
which could then be used as a repository, at least for
Java-based domains.

Derek
